newsitem.title: USA: U.S. state of Missouri executes killer of four men.
newsitem.headline: U.S. state of Missouri executes killer of four men.

text.p: Donald Reese, who killed four men in a 1986 robbery, was executed by lethal injection early on Wednesday, a spokesman for Missouri's department of corrections said.

Reese, 54, was arrested June 15, 1986 -- one week after the bodies of James Watson, Christopher Griffith, John Burford and his brother-in-law, Don Vanderlinden, were found at a rifle range in central Missouri. Reese later confessed to the killings and to having taken wallets from three of the men.
He was sentenced to death for murdering Watson and was given life without parole for killing Griffith.
Reese's last meal consisted of six fried shrimp, french fries, ice cream and a large soft drink, according to Tim Kniest, a spokesman for the Missouri Department of Corrections.
"I love everybody," Reese said in a brief final statement.
Kniest said 27 demonstrators gathered outside the correctional centre before the execution. Most of the demonstrators were opposed to capital punishment.
About 25 opponents of capital punishment also staged a silent protest on Tuesday evening at a busy traffic intersection in Kansas City, Mo.
